definitions.definition: the story of a book, film, play, etc.:
examples: The movie has a very simple plot.

definitions.definition: a secret plan made by several people to do something that is wrong, harmful, or not legal, especially to do damage to a person or a government:
examples: The plot was discovered before it was carried out.

definitions.definition: to mark or draw something on a piece of paper or a map
to make marks to show the position, movement, or development of something, usually in the form of lines or curves between a series of points on a map or piece of paper:
examples: Radar operators plotted the course of the incoming missile.
